result.execSummary:
The defendant Cortez D Britton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cortez D Britton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cortez D Britton was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

called at 11:41, Cases called: 15CF492 & 16CF15, Defendant Cortez D Britton in court, in custody with attorney Spansail, special for attorney Avena.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both parties have received revocation paperwork. Sentencing statements. In 15CF492, Court sentenced defendant to 6 months jail commencing immediately. Huber granted.  Civil judgment for $443. Court granted 47 days jail credit. In 16CF15, Court sentenced defendant to 30 days jail, concurrent with 15CF492. Court granted 47 days jail credit. Huber granted. Civil judgment for $443 costs. Court granted 47 days jail credit. Court adj. at 12:01 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 14, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Cortez D Britton in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF492 and 16CF15.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2 of Amended Information in 15CF492 and no contest to Ct. 3 of Amended Information in16CF15.  Court found defendant guilty; Judgment entered.  All other counts in both cases dismissed.   In 15CF492 Ct. 2 and 16CF15 Ct. 3, the Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 18 months, with conditions to include AODA and compliance and submission of DNA sample.  In 16CF15, $443.00 cost; 2 days credit.  In 15CF492, $443.00 costs; 3 days credit.  6 month periodic review.  10:08/10:20

Defendant Cortez D Britton in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 16CF15 and 15CF492.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant pled not guilty on all charges of both cases. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.  20 days to file motions.
